text: I could announce one morning that the world was going to blow up in three hours and people would be calling in about my hair!
author: Katie Couric

text: But, you know, they don't enjoy the dinner hour together. It's just not as much of a ritual at night and it's interesting. I think the ritual is taking place perhaps more in the morning.
author: Katie Couric

text: But of course when people watch morning television, Terry, it's a very different animal. You know, they're running around, they're getting their kids ready for school, they're probably doing eight million things, they're brushing their teeth.
author: Katie Couric

text: All three networks have always had a morning show but now cable of course is taking some of that audience away and a variety of other things, probably the Internet as well.
author: Katie Couric

text: Well, when I was a kid and I watched 'Speed Racer,' I used to always watch it in the morning with my cereal. And when I ate the cereal, I would pour soda into the cereal because we never really had milk for some reason, I don't know.
author: Emile Hirsch
